result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler T. Kresal

defendant.name: Kresal, Tyler T.
defendant.address: W458 Albany NN Street, Mondovi, WI 54755

records.addlTxt: Proposed Order for Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement

2:41 PM Defendant Tyler T. Kresal in court with Attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Mr. Kresal previously appeared and was informed of his charges.  Mr. Kresal waives his statutory right to PH and have an agreement and waive the timely filing of Information as long as it mirrors the complaint and wish to proceed in this matter.  Mr. Seifert has the Information that mirrors the complaint.  The offer sent to Attorney Hillestad if plead to count 1, offer a 12 month DAGP.  Mr. Hillestad reports they have signed the DAGP and needs Mr. Seifert's signature.  DAGP presented to the Court.  Court reviews primary condition of the DAGP contract to turn over his firearms to the PCSD.  Mr. Seifert will contact the Sheriff's Dept. to make them aware of this.  Court reviews charge/max. penalties and right to PH.  Court finds Mr. Kresal KVI waives his statutory right to PH and an Information will be filed to mirror the complaint forthwith.  Court reviews constitutional rights with Mr. Kresal he will be giving up if plea to the charge.  Mr. Hillestad stipulates factual basis using the criminal complaint.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Court returns DAPA to Mr. Hillestad and to make sure it is filed after Mr. Seifert signs it.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

Mr. Kresal you need to report to PCSO for fingerprints today.  Court finds Mr. Kresal KVI WTL for PH.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
